description: SEE ATTACHED DOCUMENTS FOR MORE INFORMATION
full_summary:
# Government Tender Announcement

## Title
Pack and Harness Assembly (# cb-876-83651950)

## Solicitation Information

* Tendering Method: Competitive Open Bidding
* Government Procurement Category: Goods and Services
* Trade Agreements: Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* Procurement Notice Number: W8485-247842/C
* Publication Date: December 15, 2023
* Tender Closing Date and Time: January 9, 2024, at 2:00 PM (EST)
* Expected Contract Start and End Dates: To be Determined

## Tender Summary

The Department of National Defence invites bids for a Pack and Harness Assembly contract. The tender includes the delivery of 20 units, NSN 1670-21-844-2125, from the FCA plant to 15 Westwin Ave.

**Tender Description**
The Department of National Defence requires the provision of Pack and Harness Assembly items, as detailed below.

* Item 1: Pack and Harness Assembly Assy, Part No: 8927707-1, NSN: 1670-21-844-2125, Quantity: 20 units
* Delivery: From FCA Plant to 15 Westwin Ave
* Unit of Issue: Individual
* Security of Information: Non-sensitive

**Bidder Requirements**

* Bidders may submit their bids in either official language of Canada.
* Preference will be given to Canadian goods and/or services.
* The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.

## Contract Information

* Contracting Entity: Department of National Defence
* Contact Information: Ryan Duncan, [ryan.duncan@forces.gc.ca](mailto:ryan.duncan@forces.gc.ca), 613-292-9650

## Tender Documents

The tender package is available through the Government of Canada's Buy and Sell platform.

[Attachment URL: English Version](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/27697/w8485-247842-rfp-english.pdf)
[Attachment URL: French Version](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/27697/w8485-247842-rfp-french.pdf)

Note: As per Government of Canada standards, please ensure your bid is compatible with the requirements outlined in the tender package. Suppliers are also reminded that the Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.
